alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Southern San Luis Valley; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 3:36PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Huerfano, east central Costilla and western Las Animas Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 334 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southern Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Costilla county, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, half inch hail and locally heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. High flows in creeks and streams off the southwest side of the Spring burn scar will be possible, especially Wagon Creek. Locations impacted include... Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Costilla county, and Wagon Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
